title: #226A: SHADOW PLANET
author: A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page I
filename: 226 - Shadow Planet - World Apart - AK Benedict & Scott Handcock_djvu.txt

elements.text: PART ONE
SCENE 1. INT. TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM
FX: TV MOVIE CONTROL ROOM. B/G HUM, BUT NO TIME ROTOR. THE
DOCTOR IS TINKERING UNDER CONSOLE: LIGHT TAPPING OF HAMMER,
CRANKING OF NUTS.
(TUTS) (TO HIMSELF) I was sure this would work. I wonder... if I just turn this an eek of a degree left... yes, that might do it.
How much longer are you going to be, Professor?
Patience, Ace.
But I’m bored.
Can’t you and Hex go bowling?
When we said we’d like to go bowling in the TARDIS sometime, we meant tenpin bowling. You know: lanes, strikes, weird shoes. Not lawn bowls.
Lawn bowls, Ace, is a game of hats, strategy and precision, followed by tea. A noble sport. Wars should be fought on the bowling green.
FX: ACE IS PACING.
But we need to do something!
You’re going to have to entertain yourselves, I’m afraid.
(APPROACHES FROM OFF, WHISTLING) Where are we off to, then?
Apparently we’re to occupy ourselves.
FX: THE DOCTOR TIGHTENS A SCREW.
Why? What’s he up to?
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 3
Enhancing the TARDIS, Mister Hex. I’ve been meaning to add this particular feature for a while... (BEAT) There, that’s got it.
FX: CLANG AS A METAL PIECE FALLS FROM CONSOLE.
Or maybe not.
Alright. I’1l find us somewhere to go on the Destination Monitor. Can’t be that hard.
FX: ACE PRESSES BUTTONS ON THE CONSOLE.
I don’t think you should be messing with the console, Ace.
FX: SOMETHING PINGS UP ON THE CONSOLE SCREEN.
(TRIUMPHANT) Here we go. A list of planets in the area: Spindle; Gardeline B; Hair.. (BEAT) Do you reckon Hair is a planet made of hair?
Sounds horrible. Like a hawked-up hairball in space.
FX: MORE BUTTONS.
Cross-referencing with the Index File... Hey, it says this planet’s just been opened.
How do you open a planet?
It’s called Unity. “The planet that brings you face to face with yourself.”
FX: THE DOCTOR SCRAMBLES OUT FROM UNDER THE CONSOLE.
(QUICKLY) Oh no. Sounds terribly boring. Choose another. Any other. (BEAT) I’ve heard Hair’s lovely this time of year.
You’re hiding something, aren’t you? (DECISIVE) That’s settled, then. We’re going to Unity.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 4
(WARNING) Are you sure you don’t want to reconsider?
We’re not going anywhere called Hair. I’11 tell you that for nothing.
That’s settled then.
(ACTIVATES CONSOLE) Well... don’t say I didn’t warn you.
FX: TARDIS DEMATERIALISES.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 5
SCENE 2. EXT. UNITY BEACH
FX: IDYLLIC BEACH SOUNDS: GENTLE LAP OF WAVES ON SAND, DISTANT
PARROT CHATTER. LIGHT FLUTTERING OF MOTHS. TARDIS MATERIALISES; DOOR OPENS. ACE AND HEX WALK OUT ONTO SOFT SAND.
(WHISTLES) Nice beach.
Not a patch on Skeggy.
Skeggy doesn’t have blue sand. Or pink rock pools. (CALLING OUT) Professor? Are you coming?
(CALLING LOUDLY FROM INSIDE TARDIS) Give me a chance, I’1l join you in a minute.
(CALLING BACK) Suit yourself!
FX: ACE WALKS FURTHER ONTO BEACH. WIND RUSTLES THROUGH TREES,
MOTH WINGS BEAT.
Not many people about, are there?
Just moths. A lot of moths.
(REALISING WHAT SHE’S SEEING) Oh yeah! I thought they were black and white leaves! When their wings move, it’s like the trees are breathing.
I don’t like moths. Creepy texture. Like flying pieces of old love letters, that disintegrate in your hands.
FX: DOCTOR WALKS OUT, CLOSES TARDIS DOOR BEHIND.
So this is Unity. Very nice. Very serene.
Everything alright, Professor? (SUSPICIOUS) What were you up to in there, anyway?
FX: LOGLAN WALKS ACROSS TO THEM, CARRYING A TRAY OF CLINKING
GLASSES.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 6
Oh, nothing much.
(CALLING OUT) Hello!
Ah! — The welcoming committee.
Where did he spring from?
(ARRIVING) Welcome to Unity. May I take your booking reference?
We don’t have one. Thought we’d just turn up.

No matter. We have taster sessions available to see if finding you.. is for you. I’m Loglan, your host. (BEAT) Would you like a complimentary juice? It’s made from the fruit of the Lantern tree, picked halfway up the Pale mountain.
Yes, please!
I don’t think we would, thank you.
Professor!
Never accept drinks from strangers, Ace.
Relax, Doctor!
FX: MELLIFLUOUS GONG RINGS ACROSS THE BEACH, SENDING A FLOCK OF
BIRDS, WINGS BEATING, INTO THE SKY.
Ah! The welcome meeting is about to start. You’re just in time to join your fellow guests in the Therapy Dome. (HE BEGINS TO WALK OFF) Please, follow me...
Well? We going, or what?
FX: DOCTOR, ACE AND HEX FOLLOW LOGLAN OVER SAND. FADE TO:
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 7
SCENE 3. INT. CORRIDOR
FX: MRS WHEELER’S HEELS CLICKING SMARTLY ALONG, AT PACE. SANDY
HURRIES TO CATCH HER UP.
Mrs Wheeler! Mrs Wheeler!
FX: MRS W STOPS.
What is it now, Sandy? I’m due at the welcome meeting.
An urgent message, Mrs Wheeler. From Malc[olm] — (CORRECTS HERSELF) From Professor Grove. He says he has to talk to you now, before the induction.
Well, tell him he can’t. (TURNING)
He insists, Mrs Wheeler. (BEAT) He says we can’t ignore his report.
We?
(HASTILY) You! Us! Unity Corps.
And what do you think?
I don’t know, it’s not my position to say, but maybe he has a
point, maybe —
You’re right. It’s not your position to say.
FX: ACTIVATES KEYPAD. DOOR SLIDES OPEN.
(WALKING THROUGH) Oh, and book me a dermatology appointment, urgent!
FX: DOOR SLIDES SHUT.
(MISERABLY) Yes, Mrs Wheeler.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 8
SCENE 4. INT. UNITY DOME
FX: CROWD ASSEMBLED UNDER A HUGE GLASS DOME — SHUFFLING AROUND,
EXCITED. UNDERNEATH, MOTH WINGS BEAT.
What time is it?/ Any minute now./ So exciting!/ look at all the moths! [ETC]
This place is huge.
This is just the dome — the Integration Centre is behind us. You’1l be going there after this.
Excellent.
So what are we waiting for now?
(WITH REVERENCE) Mrs Wheeler, of course.
She the boss, then?
The face of Unity, yes. Everyone knows her from the informercials. — Why don’t you...?
We don’t pay much attention to adverts.
She’s a star. People cross galaxies to come here and meet her.
All looking for a quick fix for their ids.
FX: OFF — MRS W’S HEELS CLICK ACROSS STAGE, TOWARDS MIC.
Is that her now?/ It’s her!/ Ssh! Ssh!
FX: VIA MIC, MRS W’S VOICE IS AMPLIFIED THROUGH DOME.
(CHARISMATIC, COMMANDING) Good morning, everyone, and welcome to the next stage of your lives.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 9
ENTHUSIASTIC APPLAUSE
I’m Lindsay Wheeler, CEO of Unity Corporation. I hope you’ve had a chance to walk round the dome and see our famous Unity moths?
ASSENTING MURMURS
These beautiful creatures are unique to this world. With one dark wing and one light, they’re a symbol for our mission here: two opposing sides coming together, so we can take flight.
FX: ENTHUSIASTIC CLAPPING FROM THE CROWD.

Using a combination of technology and Jungian psychology, we’ve harnessed the potential of this rare psychic planet so that you can reach yours. Within a week, each of you will overcome your shadow self and be reborn.
EVANGELICAL WHOOPING
Many of you come to this planet with broken wings.
FEVERED MURMURS OF AGREEMENT
I was the very first person to benefit from the programme. I
had broken wings of my own, once, but since stepping into the Shadow Collector, I’ve never been happier or more successful. If you put your trust in the Unity Process, that which holds
you down shall hold you down no more!
TUMULTUOUS APPLAUSE AND WHOOPING
(CLEARS HIS THROAT) (CALLING OUT) That all sounds most inspirational — but what, exactly, does this Process entail?
An excellent question and one I was just about to get to, Mr...?
Doctor.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 10
As I was saying, the psychic planet manifests your shadow self.
(CALLING OUT) Your bad side?

No, although that’s a common misconception. Your shadow self is your buried side, the one you like the least. (BEAT) Here, we can bring out that hidden self — quite literally. All of you will be able to meet your inner selves, in order to resolve the conflicts that rage inside us all.
MORE APPLAUSE
After you’ve met your shadow, you’1l be taken to the Unification Pod a mile beneath Unity’s crust. There, thanks to the planet’s psychic power, [you’1ll be re-integrated with...]
FX: OVER THIS — SCUFFLE AS GROVE IS STOPPED BY GUARDS.
Let me through! (CALLING OUT) Mrs Wheeler! Mrs Wheeler! I need to speak to you urgently, and your idiot ‘hosts’ won’t let me through.
Who’s that, making all that fuss?/ What’s going on? [ETC]
I’m in the middle of a Welcome meeting, Professor Grove. Kindly wait in my office and we can discuss your... issues later.
‘Issues’? ‘Issues’?! Did you even read my report?
Or I can ask my hosts to escort you outside. Rowan? Marcus?
Alright, alright! There’s no need for that. I’1ll go. (PARTING SHOT) But I insist that we talk, or I’1ll be taking my concerns to the shareholders!
FX: DOOR SLIDES OPEN AND SHUT, OFF.
DISQUIETED
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page I]
I’m so sorry about that. I think our Professor Grove may need another turn in the Integration machine!
RELIEVED LAUGHTER
Each of you has been assigned a host. They will now take you through to a waiting room. (BEAT) See you on the other side of you.
APPLAUSE
FX: WHEELER STRIDES OFF THE STAGE.
(MILLING AROUND, EXCITED) This is it!/ So thrilled!/ She’s just like she is in the adverts. [ETC]
FX: DOORS OPEN AND THE CROWD DISPERSES
Right then, Loglan. You’re our host. Any chance you could answer the Doctor’s question?
Question?
About what this ‘process’ entails.

I will take you all through to a waiting room, then one-by-one into Professor Grove’s Shadow Collector, which separates out your shadow self and places it inside an android, onto which your own features will have been projected. The rest was explained to you by Mrs Wheeler.
Professor Grove... that would be the same Professor Grove who was so perturbed just now?
(SERENITY ITSELF) Yes... Doctor.
Very reassuring.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 12
SCENE 5. INT. MRS WHEELER’S OFFICE
FX: DOOR SLIDES OPEN.
(ENTERS) Where is she? I have to speak to her!
(FLUSTERED) I’m sorry, Professor Grove, Mrs Wheeler isn’t back from the Welcome Meeting yet.
Please, Sandy, you don’t have to talk to me like.. like we don’t know each other.
I can alert you when she returns. She has a ten-minute window later this afternoon.
She won’t listen to me. You have to help me get through to her, Sandy.
I can’t help you, you know that. I’m her P.A., nothing more. If she caught us here, talking like this, colluding against her — she'd kill me.
Look at me, Sandy. Me and you — there’s still a connection, I know there is...
No, Malcolm! This is not appropriate. Please. You have to leave.
She’s expecting me to be here. I’m not going anywhere.
Then I will.
FX: SANDY STANDS, CHAIR MOVING AGAINST FLOOR. SHE WALKS OUT OF
THE ROOM. DOOR OPENS.
Sandy! Don’t be like that. Sandy...!
FX: DOOR CLOSES.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 13
SCENE 6. INT. WAITING ROOM
FX: LARGE, MAINLY EMPTY ROOM. LOGLAN, ACE, HEX AND DOCTOR WALK
IN, FOOTSTEPS DEADENED BY CARPET.
Come in. Please be seated.
Can’t we just get on with it? I hate waiting around.
FX: SHUFFLING OF PAPER BY LOGLAN.
Not just yet. First, could you each take one of these forms, and sign both copies?
What are we signing away, exactly?
It’s a simple indemnity, so Unity is protected in the unlikely event of... misadventure.
Like when you go skydiving.
But in this case it’s your soul that might end up in pieces.
The Shadow Collector is utterly safe. I’ve been through it.
So you’re all integrated now?
I’d say not.

Indeed, Doctor. Unity policy states that hosts are to present without their shadows. It was found that we functioned better and were much more content. My shadow self has been externalised and stored in a holding area. When my contract is up, I'll make peace with my shadow and go, as you will later today, to the Unification Pod.
(INTRIGUED, AS IF EXAMINING HIM) Don’t you resent them for taking your shadow?
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 14
(BLITHELY) Not at all. It’s very freeing. I have no doubts, no anxiety, no fear.
And there are no problems? No side effects?
None.
Ace, Hex — are you sure you want to go through with this? There’s no shame in changing your mind...
This was my idea and I’m going through with it. — Sign here, right, Loglan?
Beside the ‘X’.
FX: AS ACE SIGNS 2 x PAPERS.
What about you, Mister Hex?
I dunno. Not sure I want to take on my shadow self.
Come on! Where’s your sense of adventure?
(SIGH) Oh alright, give us the pen.
Yehhh!
FX: AS HEX SIGNS 2 X PAPERS.
Well, then: if all your paperwork’s in order... I think I’1l take a walk.
You’re not taking part?
Not on this occasion, no.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 15
Maybe you’re scared of what you might find.
Maybe what I might find would be scared of me. (BEAT) I’1l see you both later. And both of you too, Mr Hex. (DEPARTS)
Hang about, Doctor — you can’t just wander off...!
FX: AS DOCTOR WALKS OUT, LOW CHIME SOUNDS FROM OFF.
It’s time to take you through to the Shadow Collector. Who wants to go first?
Me!
You’re keen.
I’m bored. I want something to happen.
(TO HEX) Wait here, please, sir. I’1ll return for you presently.
FX: AS ACE AND LOGLAN WALK OUT.
(CALLING AFTER) See youse both laters, then...!
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 16
SCENE 7: INT. CORRIDOR
FX: WALKING BRISKLY ALONG.
Now if I were Mrs Wheeler’s office, where would I be? (STOPS) How about... here?
FX: OPENS DOOR.
(SHOCKED) Excuse me!
Please, don’t get up, madam! I’m the Doctor. Delighted to make your acquaintance. I don’t suppose you could tell me [where]
The doctor, thank goodness. Please, would you take a look at this bite on my arm? It’s all yellow, and it seems to be spreading —
I’m sorry, I don’t have any appointments free for the next ten thousand years.
What?
Fully booked, I’m afraid. Now: you wouldn’t happen to know where I might find Mrs Wheeler’s office, would you...?
Second floor, other side of the Dome. But —
Thank you, madam. You’ve been most helpful. Er, about that bite...
Yes?
You should get it seen to, it looks nasty.
FX: CLOSES DOOR.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 17
SCENE 8. INT. SHADOW COLLECTING ROOM
FX: SMALL, CLAUSTROPHOBIC ATMOS; TILED WALLS AND FLOOR. LOW,
THROBBING HUM FROM MACHINE. HIGH CHIME SOUNDS.
The Shadow Collector is ready. You can go inside now, Ace.
“The Shadow Collector”. Sounds like a fairytale villain. Not sure I want to lose my shadow to a fairytale villain.
It’s just a name.
This is real, right? Cos it sounds like magic, not science.

Science involves enquiry, and the methodical examination of replicable physical results. Professor Grove has found a way to integrate people quickly, again and again. He’s proven Jung’s theories, without months or years of painful psychoanalysis.
Guess most things sound like magic till they happen every day, then they’re just normal. — So, what, I just walk through into
this booth?
Enter the Collection chamber and lie on the bed. I’11 be able to see you from the control room next door. When you’re secure, I will begin the Process.
Let’s do it. (BEAT) Here goes nothing.
FX: FOLLOW ACE AS SHE STEPS INTO BOOTH.
Cramped. — Loglan! Can you see me from there?
(D) Perfectly, now just lie down.
Alright —
FX: SHE LIES DOWN. BEAT. THEN — 4 x CLAMPS CLOSE AUTOMATICALLY
AROUND HER LIMBS.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 18
What the — It’s clamped me! I can’t move!
(D) The restraints are for your own protection.
FX: MACHINE WHIRRS INTO ACTION. THROBBING.
No, wait, I’m not [sure —]
(D; OVER NOISE) Don’t worry, you’ll be in the recovery room just a few minutes’ time.
FX: UP THROB PITCH. FADE.
in
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 19
SCENE 9. INT. MRS WHEELER’S OFFICE
FX: DOOR SLIDES OPEN, MRS W WALKS THROUGH.
There you are, at last!
Professor Grove. I hope my assistant made you an appointment. — Where is that wretched girl...?
Never mind her, Lindsay. It’s you I came to see.
(SIGH; SITS AT DESK) Make it quick, Malcolm, I have only the briefest window. (SLIGHT ITCHING ON HAND) Ahh...!

Yes, well — you said we’d be reducing numbers, not increasing them. This is the third intake today. The planet can’t replace its psychic core quickly enough to meet demand. (INTIMACY HINTED AT) Lindsay — this isn’t what we set out to do.
LE 2Sn tt?
We set out to help people feel as good about themselves as we did when we first arrived. — Don’t you remember that, Lindsay?
How things used to be?
We used to be broke.
I meant —
I know what you meant. — Actually: I’m glad you’re here, Malcolm. I’m thinking of introducing an express service. Bypassing the middle stage, that’s what takes so long.
You can’t expedite the process of self-knowledge!
But you have! You, Malcolm, have made a fly-through for the soul!
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 20
SCENE 10. INT. RECOVERY ROOM
FX: LOGLAN WHEELS ACE INTO A SMALL, FURNISHED ROOM. ETHEREAL
MUSIC PLAYING.
(WOOZY AND SHAKY) Nice place to recover, Loglan. Your interior decorator really likes white.
How are you feeling?
Like I’ve been sent flying after an explosion.
Not anxious at all?
(WITH EFFORT AS SHE TRIES TO STAND) Bit wobbly. Like after giving blood. You got a biscuit?
Why do you want a biscuit?
That’s what you get where I come from, after giving blood.
Why would you give blood?
To help people, dummy. You know, in hospital.
(PUZZLED) Don’t they have synthetic plasma, where you come
from?
Doesn’t matter. I could still use a Custard Cream, though.
FX: BEEPS FROM DIAGNOSTIC TOOL.
Pulse normal. Temperature normal. No chemical imbalances.
I could’ve told you that.
Good. Well, then — I’d better go to your friend, Mr Hex.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 2]
Wait, you’re just going to leave me on my own?
You won’t be alone.
FX: LOGLAN OPERATES KEYPAD. DOOR SLIDES OPEN.
Ace — meet your shadow self.
(ENTERING) (COLD) Wotcha.. ‘Ace’.
Oh my G—
It’s just me and me now. What will we find to talk about?
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL)
SCENE 11: INT. MRS WHEELER’S OFFICE
FX: DISTANT EARTH TREMOR. WINDOWS RATTLE.
Did you feel that?
Feel what, Malcolm? (ITCHING SKIN) Ah...!
The ground shook. That was an earth tremor!
We’ve had them before.
The planet’s hurting. It’s warning us, Lindsay!
Page
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 23
SCENE 12: INT. RECOVERY ROOM

(TO SHADOW ACE) I can’t get my head round this. Are you what I look like? Cos normally when I look in the mirror, I only see my mirror face, know what I mean, the one you put on to see yourself. (BEAT) Course you know what I mean. You’re me. Or are you? This is so confusing.
Well, aren’t you chatty?
What do you want to do now? We could go exploring, off round the island, anywhere you like.
I don’t want to go anywhere with you.
Come on, we have to do something.
No, you have to do something. It’s what you always do — run around, blow things up, make all that noise to stop yourself from hearing me.
That’s ridiculous.
Is it?
(DISCOMFORT) Remind me never to get my shadow removed again. I’d rather go to the dentist’s.
No you wouldn’t. You’re scared of dentists.
I’m not scared of anything.
Yeah, right.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 24
SCENE 13: INT. MRS WHEELER’S OFFICE
Please, Lindsay — at least hold off any more groups while I reconfigure the machine.
We can’t. I have responsibilities to our shareholders. And to our guests, of course.
What about the planet?
Planets don’t sign contracts — (ITCHING) Ahh!
Why do you keep doing that?
What?
Scratching your arm.
Just a slight skin irritation.
Show me.
(PULLING UP SLEEVE) It’s infuriating. I hope that girl remembered to book me into dermatology.
(REACTS) That’s an insect bite. Looks sore. [It might be infected. ]
FX: COMMS BLEEP.
There’s that girl, at last. (FX: MONITOR INTO LIFE. DISTANT ALARM IN BACKGROUND OF SCREEN) Sandy! Did you remember my appointment?
(D; OVER MONITOR) No, I — got distracted.
For the last time, girl, when I tell you to do [something]
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 25
(D) Mrs Wheeler, please! I’m in the security section. There’s an alert.
What is it?
(D) One of the Shadow Hosts has escaped from the holding bay.
How? !
(D) There was an earth tremor. The locks cut out for a moment.
Where is he now?
(D) He ran out into the corridors. He could be anywhere.
Lindsay — you need to sound a general alarm.
No! We will not cause panic. The Shadow shall be isolated, and the host removed from the planet.
But we won’t be able to reunite host and shadow.
Too bad. — Meet me in the Control Room, Sandy. We’1ll track his progress from there.
(D) Yes, Mrs Wheeler.
FX: COMMS OFF. AS MRS W CROSSES ROOM:

I told you this would happen if we continued to place the planet under stress. It’s having an effect on everything. We’re not meant to be kept from our shadows for that long. (BEAT) You know what it’s done to you. Before that we were fine, [but after —]
Before that I was weak... like you. Out of my way, Malcolm.
FX: DOOR SLIDES OPEN.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 26
Lindsay, please!
I’m going now. But I need to make sure you can’t cause any further disruption.
FX: MRS WHEELER STRIDES OUT. DOOR CLOSES. THEN LOCKS BEHIND HER
WITH AN ELECTRONIC BEEP.
Lindsay? (REALISATION) She’s sealed me in! — Lindsay!!!
FX: CLICK OF MRS W’S HEELS WALKING OFF OUTSIDE.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 27
SCENE 14: INT. RECOVERY ROOM
How about we go and find the Professor? Bet he can’t wait to meet you.
Every time we go off with him, we almost get killed. Not for me, thanks.
We can’t just stand around here doing nothing! You’re much less fun than I thought.
You mean I don’t want to put us in danger all the time? Is that what you mean by fun?
Yes! (ASIDE) No wonder I don’t want people to see this side of me.
You were the one who wanted to drag me out.
I’m beginning to wish I hadn’t.
You can’t wish me away now. You can’t click your heels and have me slink back into the dark.
Yes, I can. That’s what the other machine is for. We’re going to resolve our issues then be popped back together.
What if I don’t want to be unified with you?
FX: SHADOW ACE BEGINS WALKING TO DOOR.
What do you mean? Hey, come back!
You’1l have to catch me first. (FX: SHADOW ACE ACTIVATES DOOR) See how easy it is to catch a shadow.
(GRABBING SHADOW) No, wait...!
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 28
Leave... me.. alone!!! (SHOVES ACE)
(REELING) Ahh! — Where are you going? Come back here!
Not on our life.
FX: SHADOW ACE EXITS, RUNNING.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 29
SCENE 15. INT. MRS WHEELER’S OFFICE
FX: DISTANT EARTH TREMOR, AS BEFORE. GROVE HAMMERS ON THE DOOR.
Someone help me, please! — I need to get out!
FX: SUDDENLY — DOOR SLIDES OPEN.
Professor Grove, I presume?
How did you do that? Mrs Wheeler has the only key.
You can do a lot with an umbrella, a safety pin and an optimistic outlook.
Who are you? What do you want?
I’m the Doctor, and I want to know exactly what it is you’ve done to this planet.
This planet has helped to me heal tens of thousands of people each year.
(ANGER RISING) And before then? What was the planet doing before you got your hands on it?
Well, it —

I’1ll tell you, shall I? Because I’ve been here before, when this planet had its own name: Umbra. When the ancient Umbrians walked its lands and went to the woods with their shadows. Where are they now, the Umbrians? Where are the people who understood this world?
We encouraged them to take up residence on one of the nearby moon colonies.
You encouraged them?
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 30
There were.. financial inducements...
And so this planet was sold into slavery.
I admit we’ve gone too far with the mining. But you can’t enslave a planet...!
FX: ANOTHER DISTANT TREMOR.
I’m not sure Umbra agrees with you.
Maybe so. (BEAT) I’m beginning to think that it doesn’t agree with what we’ve done at all.
Meaning?
Meaning that the planet is cracking under the pressure. Literally.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 31

SANDY: (D) One of the Shadow Hosts has escaped from the holding bay.
WHEELER: How? !
SANDY: (D) There was an earth tremor. The locks cut out for a moment.
WHEELER: Where is he now?
SANDY: (D) He ran out into the corridors. He could be anywhere.
GROVE: Lindsay — you need to sound a general alarm.
WHEELER: No! We will not cause panic. The Shadow shall be isolated, and the host removed from the planet.
GROVE: But we won’t be able to reunite host and shadow.
WHEELER: Too bad. — Meet me in the Control Room, Sandy. We’1ll track his progress from there.
SANDY: (D) Yes, Mrs Wheeler.
GROVE: I told you this would happen if we continued to place the planet under stress. It’s having an effect on everything. We’re not meant to be kept from our shadows for that long. (BEAT) You know what it’s done to you. Before that we were fine, [but after —]
WHEELER: Before that I was weak... like you. Out of my way, Malcolm.
WHEELER: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 26
GROVE: Lindsay, please!
WHEELER: I’m going now. But I need to make sure you can’t cause any further disruption.
WHEELER: WITH AN ELECTRONIC BEEP.
GROVE: Lindsay? (REALISATION) She’s sealed me in! — Lindsay!!!
GROVE: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 27
GROVE: SCENE 14: INT. RECOVERY ROOM
ACE: How about we go and find the Professor? Bet he can’t wait to meet you.
SHADOW ACE: Every time we go off with him, we almost get killed. Not for me, thanks.
ACE: We can’t just stand around here doing nothing! You’re much less fun than I thought.
SHADOW ACE: You mean I don’t want to put us in danger all the time? Is that what you mean by fun?
ACE: Yes! (ASIDE) No wonder I don’t want people to see this side of me.
SHADOW ACE: You were the one who wanted to drag me out.
ACE: I’m beginning to wish I hadn’t.
SHADOW ACE: You can’t wish me away now. You can’t click your heels and have me slink back into the dark.
ACE: Yes, I can. That’s what the other machine is for. We’re going to resolve our issues then be popped back together.
SHADOW ACE: What if I don’t want to be unified with you?
ACE: What do you mean? Hey, come back!
SHADOW ACE: You’1l have to catch me first. (FX: SHADOW ACE ACTIVATES DOOR) See how easy it is to catch a shadow.
ACE: (GRABBING SHADOW) No, wait...!
ACE: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 28
SHADOW ACE: Leave... me.. alone!!! (SHOVES ACE)
ACE: (REELING) Ahh! — Where are you going? Come back here!
SHADOW ACE: Not on our life.
SHADOW ACE: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 29
SHADOW ACE: SCENE 15. INT. MRS WHEELER’S OFFICE
GROVE: Someone help me, please! — I need to get out!
DOCTOR: Professor Grove, I presume?
GROVE: How did you do that? Mrs Wheeler has the only key.
DOCTOR: You can do a lot with an umbrella, a safety pin and an optimistic outlook.
GROVE: Who are you? What do you want?
DOCTOR: I’m the Doctor, and I want to know exactly what it is you’ve done to this planet.
GROVE: This planet has helped to me heal tens of thousands of people each year.
DOCTOR: (ANGER RISING) And before then? What was the planet doing before you got your hands on it?
GROVE: Well, it —
DOCTOR: I’1ll tell you, shall I? Because I’ve been here before, when this planet had its own name: Umbra. When the ancient Umbrians walked its lands and went to the woods with their shadows. Where are they now, the Umbrians? Where are the people who understood this world?
GROVE: We encouraged them to take up residence on one of the nearby moon colonies.
DOCTOR: You encouraged them?
DOCTOR: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 30
GROVE: There were.. financial inducements...
DOCTOR: And so this planet was sold into slavery.
GROVE: I admit we’ve gone too far with the mining. But you can’t enslave a planet...!
DOCTOR: I’m not sure Umbra agrees with you.
WHEELER: Maybe so. (BEAT) I’m beginning to think that it doesn’t agree with what we’ve done at all.
DOCTOR: Meaning?
WHEELER: Meaning that the planet is cracking under the pressure. Literally.
WHEELER: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 31
WHEELER: SCENE 17. INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE CONTROL ROOM
WHEELER: SHADOW LOGLAN TRIES TO DESTROY UNITY PROPERTY. MRS W RUNS UP.
WHEELER: Sandy! Where’s Loglan’s shadow now?
SANDY: That’s him in the control room, Mrs Wheeler. Smashing the place
SANDY: up.
WHEELER: Malcolm should’ve anticipated this: the more devoted the employee, the more angry and resentful the shadow. (CALLING OUT) Loglan! Shadow Loglan! Come out of there right now!
SHADOW LOGLAN: (AT WINDOW) Mrs Wheeler! Our esteemed overseer! How can I help you today? Need something fetched? Carried? Shadowed?
WHEELER: What do you hope to achieve, with this wanton destruction?
SHADOW LOGLAN: We’ve been repressed for too long. I’m going to let the shadows out of the holding bay!
WHEELER: (CALLING) Security!
SHADOW LOGLAN: You can’t hurt me. If you hurt me, other Loglan loses me!
SANDY: He’s right, Mrs Wheeler.
WHEELER: Security — destroy that shadow.
WHEELER: GUARDS x 2: Ma’am.
WHEELER: I don’t want to hear it, Sandy.
WHEELER: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 32
SHADOW LOGLAN: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 33
SHADOW LOGLAN: SCENE 18. INT. CORRIDOR
GROVE: Where are we going?
DOCTOR: That’s the ultimate question. Right now, we’re going to shut down this facility before the planet fractures.
WHEELER: (OVER TANNOY) (STEELY YET PLEASANT) All guests are to return to their rooms immediately. I repeat, all guests are to return to their rooms immediately.
GROVE: Something’s happened. She’d never order a lockdown unless something bad had happened.
DOCTOR: No, I doubt that she would.
GROVE: The control room. Hurry!
GROVE: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 34
GROVE: SCENE 18. INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE RECOVERY ROOM
ACE: (CALLS OUT) Here, Shadow, Shadow! — Where are you? (STOPS; TO SELF) How are you supposed to call your own shadow anyway?
HEX: (WEAKLY) Ace? That you?
ACE: Hex! — You don’t look so good.
HEX: I feel like all my bones have been taken out.
ACE: What happened?
HEX: Met my shadow. Then he decked me, and ran off. What was yours like?
ACE: Awful. No fun at all.
ACE: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 35
ACE: SCENE 19. INT. CONTROL ROOM
LOGLAN: (ARRIVING) Mrs Wheeler? I got your message — (REALISATION) What happened here?
WHEELER: Your shadow happened, Loglan. Tell me: what was it made you want to do this?
LOGLAN: But I didn’t!
WHEELER: Part of you did. I’m disappointed. Sandy — Loglan will be leaving Unity. Make sure he’s on the next flight out.
SANDY: I — Yes, Mrs Wheeler.
GROVE: (TAKING IN SCENE) Oh, no...!
WHEELER: Malcolm?! I thought I locked you in...!
DOCTOR: Not everything can be locked away as securely as we’d like, Mrs Wheeler.
WHEELER: You again! Who are you? What do you want here...?
DOCTOR: Your employees’ shadow selves, for instance. Penned in, in the dark of a holding area, for months on end. No wonder they feel resentful.
WHEELER: They’1ll be re-integrated, in time.
SANDY: Loglan won’t.
LOGLAN: What?
LOGLAN: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 36
SANDY: She destroyed your shadow self, Loglan. I’m sorry.
DOCTOR: How many people do you employ here on Unity, Mrs Wheeler?
WHEELER: I have nothing to say to you.
SANDY: Close to a hundred.
WHEELER: Sandy...! I’m warning you...!
DOCTOR: And have all of them had their shadow selves extracted?
WHEELER: All except the security staff, yes.
GROVE: (REACTING TO MONITORS) Oh my goodness.
DOCTOR: Yes, I was wondering when one of you would notice.
WHEELER: Notice what?
DOCTOR: The closed circuit television feed from the holding bay. That is the holding bay, on the third screen along?
WHEELER: What on Earth are you talking about—
DOCTOR: Now, where’s the audio switch..? — A-ha!
DOCTOR: MONITORS.
SHADOW HEX: (D) Out you come! All of you!
SHADOW ACE: (D) You’re free! Free!
SHADOW ACE: 10 OR MORE SHADOWS: (D) Free! Free! Free!!!
SHADOW ACE: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 37
WHEELER: Who are those people...?
LOGLAN: The Doctor’s friends’ shadows.
GROVE: They’re letting the hosts’ shadows out!
WHEELER: What’s going on...?
DOCTOR: A revolution, Mrs Wheeler. And all our heads are on the block!
DOCTOR: 10 OR MORE SHADOWS: (D) Free! Free! Free!!!
DOCTOR: END OF PART ONE
DOCTOR: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 38

elements.text: PART TWO
FX: AUDIO FROM HOLDING BAY COMES OVER MONITORS.
(D) Out you come! All of you!
(D) You’re free! Free!
10 OR MORE SHADOWS: (D) Free! Free! Free!!!
Who are those people...?
The Doctor’s friends’ shadows.
They’re letting the hosts’ shadows out!
What’s going on...?
A revolution, Mrs Wheeler. And all our heads are on the block!
10 OR MORE SHADOWS: (D) Free! Free! Free!!!
SCENE 20. INT. CONTROL ROOM [CONTINUOUS]
FX: ANOTHER TREMOR. BIGGER THAN BEFORE.
Another tremor.
That was the biggest one yet. Mrs Wheeler, we need to evacuate!
Don’t be absurd, Sandy. This is just a.. temporary difficulty.
Look at the shadows, on the screens...!
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 39
They’re on their way here.
To the Control Room? Why?
To take control. Obviously.
(PANICKING) So what are we going to do?!
The planet’s breaking down. We need to put it back together. You need to put it back together... Professor Grove.
Me? How?
We can discuss that on the way. — Who else is coming?
Sandy, Loglan — stay where you are!
I’m sorry. I saw what you did to Loglan’s shadow.
So?
The Doctor’s right. You’ve lost control.
(LOSING IT) I am still in control!
(SARCASM) Evidently.
Come on...!
FX: GROVE, DOCTOR, SANDY AND LOGLAN RUN OUT.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 40
SCENE 21. INT. CORRIDOR
FX: ACE & HEX JOGGING ALONG.
Ace, where are we going?
To find the Doctor. And where do we find the Doctor...?
HEX/ACE: (TOGETHER) Where the trouble is.
Exactly.
FX: TANNOY ALERT SOUND. THEY STOP.

(D) Ladies, gentlemen and all gender identities. There has been a small security breach within Unity. Please stay in your rooms and wait for further instructions. This is a precautionary measure, there is no cause for panic.
She shouldn’t have said that.
Why?
Because when people are told not to panic...
They panic.
And when people panic...
They run.
FX: SEVERAL DOORS SLIDE OPEN ALONG THE CORRIDOR, IN VERY RAPID
SEQUENCE. GUESTS RUSHING OUT, TOWARDS HEX AND ACE.
(PANICKING) We’ve got to get out of here!/ Where’s the exit?/ Get out of my way!/ I don’t want to die!!
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 41
SCENE 22. EXT. BEACH
FX: WIND HOWLS ACROSS SAND. PALM TREES BUFFETTED, CREAKING.
FLUTTERING OF MOTHS RISING FROM TREES. WAVES CRASHING VIOLENTLY. DISTANT EARTH RUMBLES. DOOR SLIDES OPEN. GROVE, DOCTOR, SANDY AND LOGLAN STUMBLE OUT ONTO THE BEACH.
NB: ALL VOICES PITCHED UP OVER WIND.
Ah... it seems the local environment has turned distinctly hostile.
I’ve never seen the outside like this before. The sea’s always been calm. Now even the sand is trembling.
FX: A MOTH FLUTTERS IN SUDDENLY, BITES LOGLAN.
(BITTEN) Ow! (ASTONISHED) It bit me. That moth bit me!
I’ve never known them do that before.
A woman I saw earlier had a bite like that.
So did Lindsay —
FX: FLURRY OF MOTHS.
(BITTEN) Ow! More of them!
They’re attacking us!
The moths are part of the planet, they’re as affected by what’s been done to it as everything else.
They’re not attacking you. They’re settling on your hat.
So they are. Interesting.
FX: ANOTHER NEARBY DOOR SLIDES OPEN. GUESTS RUN OUT.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 42
(OFF, PANICKING) What’s happened to the beach?!/ Which way to the airstrip?! / We should have stayed inside!/ Somebody help!!
FX: ACE AND HEX EMERGE FROM BEHIND HORDE.
(OFF) There he is!
(OFF) Professor!
FX: AS THEY RUN OVER.
Doctor! It’s your friends!
Just in time for the end of the world.
FX: GROUND SHAKES AND KEEPS SHAKING.
SCREAM
(RUSHING UP) Get back, everyone!
The ground’s giving way!
Where?
FX: MASSIVE CRACK BENEATH LOGLAN’S FEET.
(FALLING, SCREAMING) Aaaaaaaaaah!
Loglan!
Forget it, he’s gone.
Gone where?!
Into the broken heart of this planet.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 43
The whole world’s cracking up!
Literally. And what do we do when someone ‘cracks up’, as you put it?
Listen to them. Talk to them. Start to put the pieces back together.
Exactly, Staff Nurse Schofield! — Professor Grove: there’s a direct link between the Unification Pod and the planet’s psychic core — correct?
It’s in a lava pool, a mile underground. Sometimes you hear sounds there, like voices.
So how do we get to it?
We built a shuttle. It runs along a fault line, to the pool.
Right then. Let’s go give this planet some therapy.
But the guests! We have to get them safe!
The lady’s got a point.
It’s Sandy.
Sandy’s got a point. We should round them up, get them to the TARDIS.
That... might be a problem.
Why?
We left the TARDIS by that bunch of palm trees, at the far end of the beach, right?
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 44
Right, just over there- (TRAILS OFF) Oh no.
I don’t see them any more, do you?
It must’ve fallen down the crack, like Loglan!
Lindsay — Mrs Wheeler - has a space-jet partway up the Pale Mountain. For shareholders and executives only.
I know where it is.
Right then, Sandy. Let’s you and me lead everyone up there.
Good luck, both of you.
FX: HEX AND SANDY DEPART.
We gonna get this shuttle, then?
This way.
FX: GROVE LEADS THEM AWAY. CROSS TO:
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 45
SCENE 23. EXT. ANOTHER PART OF BEACH [CONTINUOUS]
FX: RUMBLES CONTINUE. SHADOW HEX & ACE WALK UP.
There you go, Shadow Ace. With the Doctor. Running into danger.
There you go, Shadow Hex. Saving everyone. Being noble.
SHADOW HEX and ACE: (TOGETHER) Boooring!
What do we do now, now the whole place is in chaos?
Nothing.
Nothing?
We’re on a beach. I never get the chance for a beach holiday with her in charge. Sometimes, I just want to put my feet up and do nothing.
Sometimes, I wonder why I bother saving anyone. I mean, what’s the point? We’ve all gotta die sometime.
Exactly. So why all the stress, when we could just crack open a deckchair...
FX: SHE SNAPS OPEN A WOODEN DECKCHAIR AND SITS WITH A CREAK.
And let the world go to hell.
FX: HE DOES THE SAME. MORE TREMORS. MORE CRACKS. GUESTS RUN
ALONG IN B/G.
(OFF) There’s nowhere safe!/ Watch your feet!/ (FALLING, LIKE LOGLAN) Aaaaaaaah!
Lovely day.
Lovely view.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 46
SCENE 24. INT. SHUTTLE ROOM
FX: HUM OF MACHINERY. GROVE, DOCTOR & ACE RUN IN, TO STOP.
That’s the shuttle?
Designed to withstand lava, apparently.
I’ve seen sturdier-looking Go-Karts. Come to think of it, I’ve built sturdier Go-Karts!
Get in, both of you.
FX: AS THEY CLIMB IN, GROVE PRESSES BUTTONS ETC ON CONTROL
BOARD. WARNING BLEEPS.
Er... Should there be red lights flashing everywhere, Professor?
No.
Other Professor!
No.
Didn’t think so.
The hull might be able to cope with the increased temperatures, but I’m not so sure about the motors.
So you’re saying this might be a one-way trip?
It’s possible, yes.
You go, Ace. Professor Grove and I can manage by ourselves.
I’m not scared, you know.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 47
Of course you’re not. The other Ace has run off with your fear, taking your bravery with it.
I’m the brave one!
There’s no bravery without fear.
Brave or not, I’m sticking with you, Professors. Closer than a shadow.
FX: BLEEPING SUGGESTING SHUTTLE IS READY. DOORS CLOSE
AUTOMATICALLY.
Mind the doors. And strap yourselves in. (FX: AS THEY STRAP THEMSELVES IN) We’1ll be going at extreme speed.
Faster than a Go-Kart downhill, without brakes? I doubt it.
FX: SHUTTLE WHOOSHES OFF.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 48
SCENE 25. EXT. ROCKY HEADLAND
FX: END-OF-WORLD ATMOS CONTINUES. SANDY & HEX HIKING UP HILL.
MOTHS FLURRY.
(CLIMBING TO STOP) Urgh, (SPITS OUT MOTH WINGS) these moths get everywhere. Did I tell you, I can’t stand moths?
Hex! Down there! Look!
Oh right, the executive jet. Least we know it’s secure. So, what, we get back down to the beach, direct people this-a-way?
FX: DISTANT RUSHING HEELS, BELOW.
It’s not secure, though.
That’s wots-her-face, Mrs Wheeler! Hey — you don’t think she’s abandoning everyone here?
I know her, Mr Hex.
Alright, but she can’t fly that thing alone! — Can she?
She doesn’t need to. It’s got an automatic pilot.
She’d really just leave everyone to die?
It wouldn’t bother her. She jettisoned empathy with her shadow. Much less bother in business.
I kinda feel sorry for her.
Me too. But she shouldn’t get away with it. Come on.
FX: RENDING OF CRACKS BELOW.
(AS THEY DESCEND) Watch your footing, the ground’s cracking...
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 49
SCENE 26. INT. POD OVER LAVA
FX: EERIE ATMOS — WE’RE INSIDE A VAST ECHOEY POD OVER BOILING
MAGMA. CREAKS AND HISSES AND RUMBLES THROUGH GLASS. SHUTTLE DESCENDS TO A SUDDEN HALT. BEAT. DOOR OPENS AND GROVE, THE DOCTOR AND ACE EMERGE, COUGHING ON SMOKE.
(COUGHS) You weren’t joking about the extreme speed, Professor!
(COUGHS) Nor the motors, I think, to judge by the smoke pouring out of them.
(COUGHS) I’m sorry. I did warn you.
Great. Did this pod thing have to be so far underground?
I needed to access the faultline to tap psychic energy direct from the planet’s psychic core. It drains here, into the Anthropos Mechanism, then gets diverted up to the Shadow Collector.
FX: ACE WALKS ACROSS POD. KNOCKS ON THICK GLASS-LIKE MATERIAL.
When you said ‘pod’, I'd imagined something small. Not the
inside of a huge glass sphere, looking out over a sea of lava.
It is quite spectacular, I admit.
It’s amazing. How did you build all this, even?
Well...
Yes, Professor Grove. Do tell.
Well, we had very advanced excavation machinery.
And?
And universe-class engineers.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 50
And labour? What about labour, Professor Grove?
(MISERABLY) Many of the Umbrians worked on the excavation programme, as part of the resettlement deal.
So, wait a minute, are you saying that you got the people of this planet to build you all this — then cleared them all out?
I expect they were cheap.
That’s sheer exploitation!
(QUIETLY) I know.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 51
SCENE 27. EXT. AIRSTRIP
FX: MRS W'S HEELS CLIPPING SMARTLY ACROSS TARMAC. HEX AND SANDY
RUNNING UP.
(OFF, CALLING OUT) Hey, you! Mrs Wheeler!
Oh, no...
(ARRIVING) Pretty smart space-jet you’ve got there.
How many of your guests do you intend to fly out of Unity?
Leave me alone, both of you!
Were you really going to leave me here to die with everyone else?
(LYING) Of course not, Sandy.
Can’t kid a kidder, Mrs Wheeler. We know what you were up to.
Come back with us to the complex. We need to evacuate everyone that we can.
Well, look at you — all commanding now. Maybe I taught you something after all. (BEAT) Why should I help anyone?
Because it’s all your fault. And because they’1ll listen to you. You’re a celebrity.
FX: MASSIVE CRACK THROUGH TARMAC. JET FUSELAGE SHUDDERS.
Whoa! That jet’s never going to take off unless we get a move on!
Exactly. There’s no time! One chance, Sandy. Come with me, or die. Your choice. I’m indifferent either way.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 52
We could have done great things together, you and me. But you only ever wanted to your shadow for a dogsbody.
Wait, what? Sandy - you’re her shadow?
Of course I am!
But you don’t look or sound anything alike.
I’m in the transformation business. I transformed.
I have the face and voice and name she used to have, before the fractal facial reconstruction, and the voice reshaping. I’m everything she didn’t like about herself. Everything she wanted buried.
And it’s cheered me up no end, Sandy dear, to look at you every hour of every day, and see how improved I am.
That’s all I am to you. The ‘before’ picture in the makeover.
Well, yes. I don’t need you. (BEAT) Now get out of my way.
FX: CRACK RUMBLES NEARER.
Careful!
Goodbye, Hex. Tell Malcolm — Professor Grove — tell him I’m sorry.
Never mind him. Come on, girl!
You’re not going with her?!
No. But I won’t let her leave without me. (LUNGES AT MRS W)
FX: THEY TUSSLE.
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 53
Sandy? Sandy, no! Get off me, get off!
You're going nowhere without me.
No, stop, both of youse! You’re gonna fall...!
(FORCING MRS W OVER) I’m a good shadoooo00000w—
(SIMULTANEOUSLY) Noooo00000000000...!
FX: BEAT.
Aw, no...
FX: RENDING OF METAL AS JET SHUDDERS AND FALLS DOWN CRACK AFTER
THEM — CRASH!
Great. There goes our only way off of this planet!
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 54
SCENE 28. INT. POD OVER LAVA
FX: DOCTOR WALKS A SHORT DISTANCE, KNOCKS ON METAL MACHINE.
So this is the Anthropos Mechanism?
Well, that’s the capsule. Climb inside, and you’re connected to the mill that grips the core of the planet, exposing you to the maximum psychic energy, knitting shadow and self together again.
But now the core itself needs to be re-integrated.
Exactly. I’m thinking — if we can reprogram the Mechanism with a model for wholeness, we can feed it back down into the planet’s core, so it can heal itself.
An excellent plan. — Right then. Stand aside, Professor Grove.
What are you doing?
I’m going to reprogram the Anthropos Mechanism.
With what? You haven’t got any tools.
With me! There’s no-one better integrated than me. I’1l be the model for wholeness.
Yeah, but the planet’s gone barmy! It might do anything to you!
If it doesn’t work, most likely my psyche will be shattered into a trillion pieces. But then, so will this planet. So what difference does it make?
Well, when you put it like that...
Look after my umbrella, would you, Ace? — Now then. (STEPS INTO MECHANISM)
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 55
FX: DOORS CLANK SHUT WITH A RESOUNDING METALLIC RING. SOUND OF
LIKE THE SHADOW COLLECTOR, BUT AMPLIFIED MANY TIMES OVER.
What’s happening? Professor Grove?
The Mechanism is trying to analyse the Doctor.
INSIDE MACHINE — LONG CRY OF TORTURED PAIN
FX: HUGE EXPLOSION WITHIN THE MACHINE.
Something’s gone wrong!!! Get him out of there!!!
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 56
SCENE 29. EXT. BEACH
FX: EARTH TREMORS, HIGH WINDS, CRASHING WAVES.
IN DISTANCE — PANICKY, SCREAMING
(CALLING OUT) You lot! Stop running around like headless chickens. The waves are gonna swamp this place! You need to get to higher ground! — For goodness’ sake, listen, will you?!
FX: SHADOW HEX & SHADOW PRROACH FROM BEHIND.
Hex, mate — chill out, will you?
(TURNING) Ace? — No, you’re not Ace. You’re her shadow.
She’s right, though. If they can’t save themselves, they’re not worth saving.
Oh, it’s you. I owe you a sock on the jaw. Only it’s, what? Plastic? Metal?
Metal, with a holo-graphene layer for a face. Go on, have a go. I dare you.
Leave it, mate — (COLLOQUIAL) ‘He’s not worth it’.
SHADOW HEX & ACE:
LAUGH TOGETHER
Right pair of comedians you are. Just leave us alone, will you? I’m trying to do something useful.
(PULLING UP METAPHORICAL HANDBAG) Ooooh! Hear that, Shadow Hex? He’s doing something useful.
It might not be much, but at least I’m not just stood around sniping from the shadows!
#226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 57
What about the Doctor, and other Ace? Shouldn’t they be your first priority ?
Good point, Shadow Hex!

WHEELER: Oh, no...
HEX: (ARRIVING) Pretty smart space-jet you’ve got there.
SANDY: How many of your guests do you intend to fly out of Unity?
WHEELER: Leave me alone, both of you!
SANDY: Were you really going to leave me here to die with everyone else?
WHEELER: (LYING) Of course not, Sandy.
HEX: Can’t kid a kidder, Mrs Wheeler. We know what you were up to.
SANDY: Come back with us to the complex. We need to evacuate everyone that we can.
WHEELER: Well, look at you — all commanding now. Maybe I taught you something after all. (BEAT) Why should I help anyone?
SANDY: Because it’s all your fault. And because they’1ll listen to you. You’re a celebrity.
HEX: Whoa! That jet’s never going to take off unless we get a move on!
WHEELER: Exactly. There’s no time! One chance, Sandy. Come with me, or die. Your choice. I’m indifferent either way.
WHEELER: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 52
SANDY: We could have done great things together, you and me. But you only ever wanted to your shadow for a dogsbody.
HEX: Wait, what? Sandy - you’re her shadow?
SANDY: Of course I am!
HEX: But you don’t look or sound anything alike.
WHEELER: I’m in the transformation business. I transformed.
SANDY: I have the face and voice and name she used to have, before the fractal facial reconstruction, and the voice reshaping. I’m everything she didn’t like about herself. Everything she wanted buried.
WHEELER: And it’s cheered me up no end, Sandy dear, to look at you every hour of every day, and see how improved I am.
SANDY: That’s all I am to you. The ‘before’ picture in the makeover.
WHEELER: Well, yes. I don’t need you. (BEAT) Now get out of my way.
HEX: Careful!
SANDY: Goodbye, Hex. Tell Malcolm — Professor Grove — tell him I’m sorry.
WHEELER: Never mind him. Come on, girl!
HEX: You’re not going with her?!
SANDY: No. But I won’t let her leave without me. (LUNGES AT MRS W)
SANDY: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 53
WHEELER: Sandy? Sandy, no! Get off me, get off!
SANDY: You're going nowhere without me.
HEX: No, stop, both of youse! You’re gonna fall...!
SANDY: (FORCING MRS W OVER) I’m a good shadoooo00000w—
WHEELER: (SIMULTANEOUSLY) Noooo00000000000...!
HEX: Aw, no...
HEX: THEM — CRASH!
HEX: Great. There goes our only way off of this planet!
HEX: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 54
HEX: SCENE 28. INT. POD OVER LAVA
DOCTOR: So this is the Anthropos Mechanism?
GROVE: Well, that’s the capsule. Climb inside, and you’re connected to the mill that grips the core of the planet, exposing you to the maximum psychic energy, knitting shadow and self together again.
DOCTOR: But now the core itself needs to be re-integrated.
GROVE: Exactly. I’m thinking — if we can reprogram the Mechanism with a model for wholeness, we can feed it back down into the planet’s core, so it can heal itself.
DOCTOR: An excellent plan. — Right then. Stand aside, Professor Grove.
ACE: What are you doing?
DOCTOR: I’m going to reprogram the Anthropos Mechanism.
ACE: With what? You haven’t got any tools.
DOCTOR: With me! There’s no-one better integrated than me. I’1l be the model for wholeness.
ACE: Yeah, but the planet’s gone barmy! It might do anything to you!
DOCTOR: If it doesn’t work, most likely my psyche will be shattered into a trillion pieces. But then, so will this planet. So what difference does it make?
ACE: Well, when you put it like that...
DOCTOR: Look after my umbrella, would you, Ace? — Now then. (STEPS INTO MECHANISM)
DOCTOR: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 55
IT FIRING UP: LIKE THE SHADOW COLLECTOR, BUT AMPLIFIED MANY TIMES OVER.
ACE: What’s happening? Professor Grove?
GROVE: The Mechanism is trying to analyse the Doctor.
ACE: Something’s gone wrong!!! Get him out of there!!!
ACE: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 56
ACE: SCENE 29. EXT. BEACH
HEX: (CALLING OUT) You lot! Stop running around like headless chickens. The waves are gonna swamp this place! You need to get to higher ground! — For goodness’ sake, listen, will you?!
SHADOW ACE: Hex, mate — chill out, will you?
HEX: (TURNING) Ace? — No, you’re not Ace. You’re her shadow.
SHADOW HEX: She’s right, though. If they can’t save themselves, they’re not worth saving.
HEX: Oh, it’s you. I owe you a sock on the jaw. Only it’s, what? Plastic? Metal?
SHADOW HEX: Metal, with a holo-graphene layer for a face. Go on, have a go. I dare you.
SHADOW ACE: Leave it, mate — (COLLOQUIAL) ‘He’s not worth it’.
SHADOW ACE: SHADOW HEX & ACE:
HEX: Right pair of comedians you are. Just leave us alone, will you? I’m trying to do something useful.
SHADOW ACE: (PULLING UP METAPHORICAL HANDBAG) Ooooh! Hear that, Shadow Hex? He’s doing something useful.
HEX: It might not be much, but at least I’m not just stood around sniping from the shadows!
HEX: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 57
SHADOW HEX: What about the Doctor, and other Ace? Shouldn’t they be your first priority ?
SHADOW ACE: Good point, Shadow Hex!
HEX: They’re alright. They’ve gone off to some underground lava pool, with Professor Grove.
SHADOW ACE: You what?
HEX: They’re gonna fix all this. I hope. They’re taking their time, mind you.
SHADOW ACE: But the planet’s breaking up! That’s just suicide!
HEX: So go and do something about it! See if they need any help! I mean, do you want her to die?
SHADOW HEX: Or do you want to be reunited with her, so you can carry on snarking while she carries you around?
SHADOW ACE: Hey, I never said you could have a pop at me!
HEX: Look, you two do what you like. But if you’re gonna do anything, go and see if the Doctor and Ace are OK, will you?
SHADOW HEX: He’s got a point, Shadow Ace.
SHADOW ACE: Reckon. Alright, then. (DEPARTING) See ya, Hex.
SHADOW HEX: (DEPARTING) Wouldn’t want to be ya!
HEX: Come on, you lot! The mountains are this-a-way!
CROSSFADE TO: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 58
CROSSFADE TO: SCENE 30. INT. POD OVER LAVA
ACE: Oh no. Get him out of there, Professor!
GROVE: I’m sorry, Ace. I think he might be —
ACE: He can’t die, that’s not how it works. Just open the door, will you?
GROVE: It only opens from the inside. A safety feature.
ACE: Pretty useless safety feature!
ACE: Doctor! Are you...?
ACE: WITH A CLANG.
DOCTOR: (WEAK) Yes, Ace? You knocked?
ACE: (RELIEF) You’re okay!
DOCTOR: Just about. I think one of my hearts stopped for a while there. But I appear to have exploded the Anthropos Mechanism.
ACE: I thought I was the one who was supposed to blow things up. (BEAT) Alright, what do we do now?
DOCTOR: Professor, any ideas?
GROVE: None at all. And there’s no way back to the surface!
DOCTOR: Then it seems I’m in my favourite place.
DOCTOR: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 59
GROVE: Where’s that?
DOCTOR: Backed into a corner.
DOCTOR: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 60
DOCTOR: SCENE 31. INT. SHUTTLE ROOM
SHADOW HEX: Ace? (FX: STATIC) Can you hear us down there? (FX: STATIC) You try, Shadow Ace.
SHADOW ACE: Ace? Oi, cloth-ears! Can you hear me??
SHADOW HEX: Ahh, leave it. Chances are they’re dead already.
SHADOW ACE: But I’d know, wouldn’t I?
HEX: (APPROACHING FROM OFF) Are you two trying to get in touch with the Doctor?
SHADOW HEX: Done with being a hero, are you?
HEX: Got a line of hosts leading people up into the mountains. Even their shadows seem to have come to their senses. Guess divided selves still have a survival instinct. — What’s going on here, then?
SHADOW ACE: Stupid comms aren’t working.
HEX: You tried thumping the console?
SHADOW ACE: What good will that do, Shadow Hex?
SHADOW HEX: Ace would thump the console. The other Ace. Not you.
SHADOW ACE: Why?
SHADOW HEX: Because she’s stubborn. Pig-headed. Never gives up. (QUIETLY, FULL OF UNSAID EMOTION) I’d miss her, if she died.
SHADOW HEX: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 61
SHADOW ACE: Aww, Shadow Hex. What about me, would you miss me?
SHADOW HEX: I’d miss both of you, like you’d miss both of me.
SHADOW ACE: I guess.
HEX: So let’s get her. For all of us. (FX: HE THUMPS CONSOLE, HARD. STATIC CLEARS) Ace? Doctor? Can you hear me?
HEX: AND CRACKLY.
ACE: (D) I’d ask “Hex, is that you?” but of course it is, who else could reach me a mile underground in a lava lake?!
HEX: You need to come back, now. Both of you.
ACE: (D) We can’t.
SHADOW ACE: Just come back, will you?
ACE: (D) Hang on, is that—?
SHADOW ACE: Yes, it’s you! Me! Look, the earthquakes are getting worse. The last place we wanna be is underground.
ACE: (D) No, I mean we can’t. The shuttle’s fritzed. There’s no way [back. ]
SHADOW ACE: There must be something we can do.
SHADOW HEX: Get you, being all pro-active! What do you call the shadow side of a shadow self?
SHADOW HEX: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 62
ACE: (D) [Get out and save yourselves. While you can. ]
SHADOW HEX: I can’t hear her. (BEAT) Hit it again!
SHADOW HEX: Ace?
SHADOW ACE: ACE!
HEX: (QUIETLY) She’s gone.
CROSS DIRECTLY TO: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 63
CROSS DIRECTLY TO: SCENE 32: INT. POD OVER LAVA [CONTINUOUS]
ACE: (DISTRAUGHT) They’ve gone. Looks like we’re on our own, Professors.
DOCTOR: No-one’s ever really on their own, Ace. Even when there’s no-
DOCTOR: one else in the room.
ACE: Eh?
DOCTOR: There are times when we should be glad of our shadows. — Now, where did you put my umbrella..? (SPOTS IT) Ah, there!
GROVE: What do you need that for...?
DOCTOR: Three lives to save, Professor. Three wishes.
DOCTOR: One. (TAP) Two. (TAP) Three. (TAP)
ACE: What the...?
ACE: Hang about — you’re —
SHADOW DOCTOR: I’m the Doctor.
ACE: But he’s -
DOCTOR: Here.
DOCTOR: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 64
GROVE: There’s two of him!
DOCTOR: Meet my shadow self.
SHADOW DOCTOR: I think you’ll find, you’re my shadow self.
DOCTOR: He’s very argumentative.
SHADOW DOCTOR: I am not!
DOCTOR: That’s me, alright. (ALOUD) Umbra? Planet Umbra? Are you listening? Are you watching, even?
ACE: I think the planet heard you...!
DOCTOR: Of course the planet heard me. This is the cave where the ancient Umbrians came, to commune with the psychic core.
ACE: What?!
DOCTOR: As you can see, Umbra, I can summon my shadow self at will.
DOCTOR: My shadow self is here, dear Umbra, to show you how well we get on.
DOCTOR: The humans who came to you took your power and turned it into money. You welcomed them and they betrayed you.
DOCTOR: They took away your means of expression, they used up your energy and then mined you for more. They did not deserve what you gave them, Umbra!
DOCTOR: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 65
DOCTOR: But neither do they deserve to die.
DOCTOR: We'll make them leave, Umbra. Destroy the mechanisms that strangle you. What do you say?
DOCTOR: Still not sure, eh? Well, Shadow Doctor — can we please show Umbra how much greater we can be when we join forces?
SHADOW DOCTOR: An excellent idea, Doctor! But how?
DOCTOR: Perhaps — through the medium of dance? A-one, two, a-one-two- three —
DOCTOR: BALL-CHANGE OR TWO WITH A TAPPING FLOURISH TO FINISH.
ACE: Can we keep the Shadow Doctor? He’s fun.
DOCTOR: And for the big finale... we merge into one.
SHADOW DOCTOR: (WALKS FORWARD) Here goes —
ACE: (CRESTFALLEN) Wait, where’s he gone?
GROVE: He just walked into you and disappeared!
DOCTOR: He’s where he always is: inside me, until I choose otherwise. An integrated personality makes use of all aspects available. Sometimes you need the you that’11l do what you won’t.
ACE: Like the weather people! Not the ones on telly, the ones where the man comes out with the umbrella when it’s raining, then, when it’s sunny, the smiley one takes his place.
ACE: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 66
DOCTOR: Exactly, Ace. — So what do you think, Umbra? Will you trust me? Both of me?
GROVE: It still doesn’t sound sure.
GROVE: THE TARDIS.
ACE: There’s a moth in the TARDIS, Doctor. It’s in the window.
DOCTOR: Probably attracted to the light out here. (BEAT) Let it out, Ace.
DOCTOR: FLIES OUT.
ACE: Whoa! Where’s it gone?
GROVE: Doctor, don’t move! It’s on your hat.
DOCTOR: (CALLING OUT) See? It likes me. They all like me, which means you like me too. Because we’re old friends, Umbra. Don’t you remember? How I sat with my shadow under your palm trees centuries ago...?
DOCTOR: Yes, I looked different then. I’ve had seven selves so far, Umbra; and with luck, more will follow. Accepting all your selves is what being a Time Lord is all about.
DOCTOR: You too can heal the fractures inside yourself, Umbra, and be at peace again. But you need to re-integrate those humans split
DOCTOR: from their shadows, too.
DOCTOR: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 67
DOCTOR: Yes, and then Unity Corps will leave this planet — won’t it, Professor?
GROVE: (CALLING OUT) Of course.
DOCTOR: (TO UMBRA) So what do you say?
DOCTOR: LINES IN AGREEMENT.
DOCTOR: Thank you, Umbra. From me and my shadow.
DOCTOR: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 68
DOCTOR: SCENE 33: EXT. BEACH
DOCTOR: BEAT, THEN THE TARDIS MATERIALISES. DOOR OPENS. ACE, PROF. GROVE AND THE DOCTOR WALK OUT .
DOCTOR: It seems to be working.
ACE: Even so. This place isn’t what it was.
DOCTOR: Give it time and it will be again.
ACE: I’m going to find Hex, make sure he’s alright.
DOCTOR: Don’t be too long, we’ll be leaving soon.
ACE: (HINT OF SHADOW ACE) You’re always telling us what to do.
DOCTOR: (WORRIED) Ace, I —
ACE: Just messing with you, Professor!
GROVE: Wh-what just happened? I don’t... I can’t...
DOCTOR: Don’t be hard on yourself, Professor Grove. The TARDIS baffles the best of them. Jung himself had to have a lie-down on my chaise longue.
GROVE: Jung was... in there?
DOCTOR: Of course.
GROVE: But how...?
DOCTOR: He helped me with a problem involving the Cyradi, a species that invades dreams.
DOCTOR: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 69
GROVE: But... when?
DOCTOR: Oh, I don’t know. Last month? Next year? Last me? (BEAT) Hard to hold onto these things sometimes, isn’t it?
GROVE: I don’t understand a tenth of what you’re saying, Doctor, but it has been a privilege to meet you.
DOCTOR: (STERN WARNING) I’11l be checking up on you. I’m placing you personally responsible for overseeing the closing-down of Unity and the return of Umbra’s original inhabitants.
GROVE: (CHASTENED) Yes, Doctor.
DOCTOR: Good.
ACE: Found him!
DOCTOR: (FONDLY) So I see.
HEX: Got no idea what just happened. The shadow usses — their faces just disappeared, they’re just plastic people with blank heads now.
DOCTOR: Yes, the shadows have gone.
ACE: Umbra’s re-integrated everyone, right?
HEX: Just like that?
ACE: Just like that.
GROVE: Mister — Hex, is it? Sandy — Mrs Wheeler’s assistant? She was with you...
GROVE: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 70
HEX: Sorry, mate. She’s gone. Her and Mrs Wheeler both. They were each other, you know.
GROVE: I know. I loved them both, once.
DOCTOR: I think it’s time that we were going. Goodbye, Professor Grove.
DOCTOR: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 71
DOCTOR: SCENE 34. INT. TARDIS — CONSOLE ROOM [CONTINUOUS]
DOCTOR: BUTTONS.
HEX: I’1l never be able to look at my shadow in the same way again.
DOCTOR: Nor should you. You never quite know what they’re up to.
ACE: You do know I know, don’t you, Professor?
DOCTOR: Know what, Ace?
ACE: The Shadow Doctor was a trick, right? What I don’t know is how it was done.
DOCTOR: Plan A was to use the Anthropos Mechanism to map my mind onto Umbra’s. Plan B was to summon up a projection from the TARDIS’s telepathic circuits. A little psychological chicanery to change the mind of the psychic planet.
ACE: I get it. It wasn’t him you were leading a dance. It was Umbra!
DOCTOR: Precisely. Therapy is a pas de deux, after all.
ACE: But you couldn’t have known we’d be meeting Umbra! Not before we landed — (REALISATION) Hang about: that was what you were
ACE: working on, wasn’t it? Under the console?
DOCTOR: I’d heard nasty rumours about Unity. It was on my list of things to investigate.
HEX: The list on the destination monitor, yeah?
ACE: What?
HEX: It’s simple, Ace. He’s had us. Again.
HEX: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 72
DOCTOR: Where to now? Hair, perhaps?
DOCTOR: ACE and HEX: (TOGETHER) No!
DOCTOR: I’‘1ll choose then, shall I?
DOCTOR: IT’S THE END OF PLAY, THEN: A SUDDEN, SICKENING LURCH!
DOCTOR: DOCTOR/ ACE/ HEX: Whoa!!!
ACE: (WINDED) Nice take-off, Doctor.
HEX: (WINDED) Yeah, you forget to take the gearstick off or something?
DOCTOR: Don’t be absurd —
DOCTOR: DOCTOR/ ACE/ HEX: Whoa!!!
DOCTOR: DOCTOR/ ACE/ HEX: Waaah!
HEX: (CATCHING BREATH) Is this gonna keep happening? Only I don’t think my guts can take it!
ACE: Lightweight!
ACE: DOCTOR/ ACE/ HEX: Ahhhh!
ACE: (RECOVERING) Actually... you may have a point.
HEX: What’s causing it? Doctor?
HEX: #226A: SHADOW PLANET by A.K. Benedict (FINAL) Page 73
DOCTOR: (AT CONTROLS) Something’s trying to materialise in the Vortex. Something colossal. The TARDIS tried to take evasive action -
ACE: (PROMPTING) But?
DOCTOR: It’s too big. We can’t outrun it. We’ve already been caught up
DOCTOR: in its gravitational pull.
HEX: You mean — whatever it is...
ACE: We’re gonna crash into it!
ACE: CLOSING MUSIC KICKS IN.
ACE: THE END
ACE: CONTINUES IN 226B: WORLD APART
ACE: #226B: WORLD APART by Scott Handcock (FINAL)
ACE: 7268 — WORLD APART
ACE: BY SCOTT HANDCOCK
THE DOCTOR: SYLVESTER MCCOY
THE DOCTOR: Time
ACE: Time
HEX: Time
HEX: traveller.
SOPHIE ALDRED: traveller’s companion.
PHILIP OLIVIER: traveller’s companion.
PHILIP OLIVIER: Page I

elements.text: PART ONE
REPRISE — FROM END OF 226A: SHADOW PLANET
(AT CONTROLS) Something’s trying to materialise in the Vortex. Something colossal. The TARDIS tried to take evasive action -
(PROMPTING) But?
It’s too big. We can’t outrun it. We’ve already been caught up
in its gravitational pull.
You mean — whatever it is...
We’re gonna crash into it!
SCENE 1. INT. TARDIS CONSOLE ROOM [CONTINUOUS]
FX: TV MOVIE CONSOLE ROOM. DOCTOR BUSY AT CONTROLS.
What is it, though?
See that large blotch on the scanner...?
Yeah, it’s getting bigger every second!
Growing larger as more of it manifests. (MAKES MIND UP) Which means, there’s only one thing for it...
FX: THE DOCTOR FLICKS SWITCHES.
What?
Emergency materialisation! That’s if the old girl lets us...
FX: PROTESTS FROM THE CONSOLE.
Page 2 of 75
#226B: WORLD APART by Scott Handcock (FINAL) Page 3
You mean we’re going to land on it?! Whatever “it” is?
Hopefully, yes.
Is that even safe?!
Probably not, no.
FX: A MASSIVE CRASH, EVERYONE CRIES OUT.
(LOUD, OVER THE CHAOS) But I think we’re all out of options! Deep breaths, everyone! Three... two...
FX: LAST FLURRY OF SWITCHES. HANDBRAKE PULLED.
SCREAM AS THEY FALL OUT OF THE VORTEX - LIKE A LIFT DROP
SCENE 2. EXT. VORTEX/BEACH.
(FX: A DESOLATE, ROCKY SHORELINE. A STIFF BREEZE BLOWS, HOWLING THROUGH A ROCKY OUTCROP. WAVES LAP ON THE SHORE. THEN WE HEAR THE FAMILIAR WHEEZE OF THE TARDIS AS IT MATERIALISES AND LANDS. THUMP! )
Page 3 of 75
#226B: WORLD APART by Scott Handcock (FINAL) Page 4
SCENE 3. INT. TARDIS CONSOLE ROOM.
(FX: THE ALARMS ARE NO MORE. A FEW SPARKS. THE DOCTOR IS UNDER THE CONSOLE, ACE AND HEX SPREAD FURTHER APART. )
GROANS, SPLUTTERS
FX: THE DOCTOR PULLS HIMSELF FROM THE FLOOR ONTO THE CONSOLE.
(CALLING OUT) Ace! Hex...?!
(CALLING OUT) I’m fine! No broken bones. Just a lot of bruising. (BEAT) Ace?!
Yeah, you know me! Water off a duck’s back! (EFFORT AS SHE STANDS )
FX: ACE AND HEX HEAD OVER TO THE CONSOLE.
What happened back there, anyway? Did we make it?
I’d very much hope so. Unless the fact of our conversation proves the existence of an afterlife.
Right. So we survived then?
Speak for yourself. (STRETCHES) Ah, my back is killing me!
Such a wimp.
Hey! We can’t all be natural space adventurers!
LAUGHS
(FX: UNDER THIS, THE DOCTOR BEEN INTERFERING WITH THE CONTROLS. )
Interesting...
Page 4 of 75
#226B: WORLD APART by Scott Handcock (FINAL) Page 5
(WARY) What is?
These readings. (STUDYING, CONFUSED) The TARDIS doesn’t seem to be able to tell me where we are!
FX: HE THUMPS THE CONSOLE HARD.
Eh? You mean we’re nowhere?!
No no no no no! I don’t mean that. I mean... well, I’m not sure what I mean!
Now you know how I feel.
FX: HE CHECKS INSTRUMENTS
The TARDIS knows where we should be. But that’s not where we are. Not where we are at all...
I honestly couldn’t tell you, Mr Hex.
(WARNING) Doctor...

I can’t, Ace! Really. (SIGHS) This planet shouldn’t even be here, not in this sector of space. I don’t know what it is! (TO HIMSELF) I had thought it might be artificial in origin, but [it would seem]
Wait! You’re saying that blotch we saw on the scanner... that was a planet?! This planet?
(SIGHS) Yes...
A planet that appeared from nowhere?!
Quite.
Page 5 of 75
#226B: WORLD APART by Scott Handcock (FINAL) Page 6
But.. But that’s impossible! (BEAT) Isn’t it?
(MUSING) Apparently not...
LONG BEAT
Okay. So, er... what do we do now?

Seriously, Hex? The Doctor’s just told us that an unidentified planet managed to ambush us in the vortex. We don’t know what it is, or where it came from. Even the TARDIS isn’t sure. For all we know, it might not even be hospitable! So... what do you think we do...?!
Well, when you put it like that, I guess we -
(INTERRUPTING) We explore, Mr Hex! That’s what we do. (SOFT, SLOWER) We explore...
Page 6 of 75
#226B: WORLD APART by Scott Handcock (FINAL) Page 7
SCENE 4. EXT. BEACH.
(FX: AS BEFORE. TARDIS DOORS OPEN. THE DOCTOR, ACE AND HEX STEP OUT ONTO A FROSTY BEACH. )
(SHIVERS) Bit cold, isn’t it?!
Oh, a little snow never hurt anyone!
It’s... pink.
Pink snow definitely never hurt anyone.
(AWED) It’s incredible.
Isn’t it?
FX: THEY STOP WALKING.
(YELLING) Hello! Anyone out there?!
Ace, keep it down, would you?!
All right! I was only checking. (BEAT, NO REPLY) Looks like we’re all alone out here...
Very much alone, yes... How strange. (BEAT) Wait. Do you hear that?
FX: A BEAT AS THEY LISTEN.
What? The wind?
No no no, not that...
The ocean?
Not that either. Listen.
Page 7 of 75
#226B: WORLD APART by Scott Handcock (FINAL) Page 8
FX: A LONGER BEAT.
(SIGHS, GIVES UP) Doctor, there’s nothing else around!
Precisely! Just the three of us. (MUSING) No obvious signs of animal life. No birds in the sky. No vegetable matter...
(SUDDENLY EXCITED) So are we the first people ever to see this then, do you reckon?
It’s possible. This planet’s not supposed to be here, after all...
Wow! Just... wow.
FX: ACE TAKES A FEW STEPS FORWARD, AWAY FROM THE SHORELINE.

SCENE 18. INT. SHELTER. RECORDED MESSAGE.
FX: A RECORDING STUTTERS INTO LIFE, SPOOLING THROUGH ENTRIES.
DOCTOR-RECORDING: Testing, testing. (WHISTLES)
FX: SPOOL.
(SHIVERING) We don’t know how long we have left any more... (DEEP BREATH) We’ve held out as long as we can.
FX: SPOOL. SETTLE ON GENERAL CAVERN ATMOS.
NOTE: ACE’S RECORDING COMES FROM A POINT LATER ON WHERE SHE’S FAR WEARIER, ALMOST NUMB. DOCUMENTING BECAUSE IT’S ALL SHE CAN DO.

We’re alone... (HEAVY SIGH) I think that’s the first time I’ve said it out loud before now. But yeah. That about sums things up. We’re alone on a world that should never have been there. A planet they call ‘Nirvana’.
We've lost all track of time. I think it’s been days? Maybe a week? I can’t be sure. The nights and days are different here. (BITTER LAUGH) An alien planet’s never felt quite so alien...

That’s why I’m recording these messages. Because I’ve heard what happened to the others, those that were here before us... and if I can help in any way, or just make you feel slightly less alone, it might - (SCOFFS) - it might actually make what’s happened to us worthwhile.
(BACK ON IT) But I’m wasting time. We don’t know how long we have left. Same goes for you. So let’s just cut to the chase and go back to the very beginning -
FX: SPOOL. RECORDING CUTS DEAD.

GROANS

I think we’re safe, if that’s what you mean. (LOOKING ROUND, SHIVERS) For now, at least...
It’s night. How did that happen?!
I think we’ve moved. There may not even be a sun where we are...
What do you mean, ‘where we are’?
Just something the Doctor told me. (BEAT) I think this whole planet’s moved...
You what? The entire planet?! Come off it, that’s impossible!
It managed to ambush us in the vortex, remember? And look, up there...
Up where? There’s nothing — oh my G—

I said I can see that! (CALMING DOWN) Sorry. (BEAT) The sky’s changed colour too...
Yeah, it’s gone a sort of... blood-red.

Should we move them, do you think? The bodies... Not sure I like

Yeah. Try picking them up and they’1ll probably snap in two. And I don’t know about you, but I’d rather just a few corpses staring at me than lots of corpse bits scattered around the room. (BRIGHTER) But that’s just my personal preference!

(SIGHS, RELUCTANT) Fine.

They said... (LYING) they said that this planet is called Nirvana... that they were safe here.. and - above all else - they said you should never, ever, ever give up hope.

We need to conserve our energy... So come on, make yourself

SCENE 21. INT. SHELTER. RECORDED MESSAGE.
FX: SPOOL. AS BEFORE.
The fire burned through till morning. Neither of us got much sleep that night: things on our mind, and the sound of the storm outside kept us awake, at least for a while.

I mean, we must have drifted off eventually. I don’t remember seeing the sun rise. Which is good, in a weird kind of way: this planet has a sun and a day, and whilst it’s not exactly the Bahamas, it’s also not cold enough to have killed us properly. Yet...

Anyway, I woke up way before Hex did, so I went outside to track the lay of the land. He must have woken a short while after me. Started studying the alien anatomies of some of the corpses. (AMUSED) Once a medic, always a medic!
FX: SPOOL.

SCENE 23. EXT. SHORELINE.
(FX: HEX CLAMBERS DOWN FROM THE CAVERN ENTRANCE AND RUNS OVER TO ACE, CRUNCHING THROUGH SNOW. )
(CALLING) You alright? You look like you’ve seen a ghost!
FX: HEX SLOWS, CATCHING HIS BREATH.
Seriously? After all the things we’ve seen - you think a ghost
would scare me?!
Fair point... But something’s rattled you.
Ah, it’s probably nothing.
What kind of “probably nothing”?
I dunno... just my mind playing tricks ‘cos of the dark. Thought I saw something, back in the tunnels.
Something, or someone?
I dunno! I didn’t get a good enough look at it. (BEAT) Them. It’s hard to say... I thought it was you, at first!
Charming.

Then you called me out here, and I just sort of freaked... (DEEP BREATH, BACK TO NORMAL NOW) So yeah, sorry. Probably just my shadow. (REMEMBERING ‘SHADOW PLANET’) Like that’s not been giving me enough grief lately.

What do you mean?
I don’t think we’re alone here. Something’s been going walkabout.

FX: HEX TAKES A STEP FORWARD.
Footprints?

They’re a little bit big for that. Oh, and webbed.
Yeah, that is a bit of a giveaway, isn’t it? (BEAT) So what do we do?
I don’t know... (THINKING) I mean, whatever these things are, they’re probably harmless.
There’s that all-important “probably” again!
Hey, you’re the one who started it! (BEAT, THINKING) But no... no, we should stay low, keep our heads down. Do everything we can not to interfere.
Never thought I’d hear you say that!
Never thought we’d be without the Doctor. He's the expert at interfering. I’m just an enthusiastic amateur!
(LAUGHS) I’m not sure you’re an amateur anything!
Yeah, yeah! (MORE SERIOUS) I mean it, though. We could do some serious damage if we’re not careful. And I mean world-changing. (BEAT) You said you thought you saw something, back in the tunnels?
Yeah, a sort of figure.. thing. It was sort of following me.

SCENE 24. INT. SHELTER. RECORDED MESSAGE.
FX: AS BEFORE.

We didn’t go far to begin with. We wanted to stay close by in case the Doctor returned, not that he has yet. We found more caves like this one, dotted along the shoreline, so we set up makeshift shelters, never straying far from where we started. You know, just in case he came and couldn’t find us. (DARK THOUGHT) Maybe he has already...?
(DISMISSING) No. No. If he’d found a way to get here, he wouldn’t leave without us. Because the Doctor isn’t like that. He finds a way. Just like we have to find one now...
(OFF, CALLING) Ace, you decent?
(FLUSTERED, TO HERSELF) Don’t give up. For his sake...
(OFF, CALLING) Only - you might want to see this!
(CALLS BACK) Coming! I’1l be right - [there]
FX: SPOOL CUTS OFF THE LAST WORD.

Uhuh. Yup. Figured an alien rock pool might have alien crabs. Spotted a few more like him over there. This fella’s the biggest so far though!

Food? We can’t just - [eat that]
We have to eat something! We’re running low on protein packs. And yeah, alright, that seaweed stuff’s fine for now - [but]
Oh, Hex, it’s rank!

(UNSURE) I guess. (BEAT) Do you even know how to cook a crab?!
